issue.title: [Debian 12, Flatpak] Game will not launch if Nvidia graphics card is used

repository.name: mcpelauncher-manifest
repository.description: The main repository for the Linux and Mac OS Bedrock edition Minecraft launcher.

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
This issue applies on Nvidia Optimus laptops (hybrid Intel/Nvidia graphics).
When trying to run Minecraft with Nvidia (proprietary) rendering enabled the game will immediately crash with the embedded log.
This does not happen when Mesa/Intel is instead rendering.

```

#9 /app/bin/mcpelauncher-client(_ZN17GLFWWindowManager12createWindowERKNSt7__cxx1112basic_stringIcSt11char_traitsIcESaIcEEEii11GraphicsApi+0x47) [0x6a8667]
```

**To Reproduce**
1. Add `__VK_LAYER_NV_optimus=NVIDIA_only __NV_PRIME_RENDER_OFFLOAD=1 __GLX_VENDOR_LIBRARY_NAME=nvidia` to current system environment to force OpenGL rendering on discrete GPU instead of integrated.
2. Launch the flatpak release of the launcher
3. launch the game

**Expected behavior**
The launcher or game should create a window to begin rendering.

**Screenshots**
![Istantanea_2023-03-28_10-34-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42090377/228178218-4663511b-4786-4de0-b36e-d2bb9add358f.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Linux, Debian 12 bookworm (Testing) amd64
 - Version: v0.8.5
 - Installation Type: Flatpak

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
All Minecraft Versions for X86_64 do not launch whatsoever when on the Flatpak version of the launcher.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a new profile with any X86_64
2. Launch the game
3. See error

**Expected behavior**
I expected the Game to launch without error.

**Screenshots**

![image](https://github.com/minecraft-linux/mcpelauncher-manifest/assets/110939089/8c6f62b9-bbc5-4db2-a856-88526d67302c)


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Pop!_OS 22.04
 - Version: v0.11.3 (build 70)
 - Installation Type Flatpak
